NATO faces dilemma as Russian military provocations multiply
subhead: From Tuesday night to Wednesday morning, Moscow launched a barrage of 450 drones against cities in western Ukraine. Poland registered the incursion of 19 flying devices into its airspace, prompting an unprecedented response from NATO.

Hundreds of South Korean workers head home after US immigration raid
subhead: A specially chartered Boeing 747 left Atlanta on Thursday carrying hundreds of South Korean workers arrested in a Trump-ordered immigration raid at Hyundai's Georgia battery plant – the largest such operation since his renewed crackdown began.

title: In Rwanda, the military cemetery keeps expanding
subhead: According to Human Rights Watch, the numerous graves dug in recent months raise questions about losses suffered by the Rwandan army in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: In Japan, the lucrative and unspoken business of ultrasound photos
subhead: Japanese peer-to-peer marketplace Mercari banned the sale of fetal images on September 1, after women bought them to convince men to marry them or extort money.

title: Living, eating and sleeping on the road: The grueling life of China's 38 million truck drivers
subhead: Nearly 70% of goods are transported across the country by truck, an essential part of the economy. But China's slowdown in growth coincides with a deterioration in working conditions and the rise of digital platforms.

subhead: The South Korean companies' metaplant in Georgia was the target of a vast federal immigration raid on September 4, during which 475 people were detained.

title: France's 'Block Everything' protests converge around ousting Macron
subhead: Although France did not come to a standstill or grind to a halt on Wednesday, numerous protests took place throughout the day across the country with large gatherings in certain cities – with headcounts between 197,000 and 250,000 people – amid the firm presence of law enforcement.
